title: Europe ‘in most difficult and dangerous situation since second world war,’ Danish PM warns – Europe live
summary: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen has expressed her support for the European Commission's plan to provide a reparation loan to Ukraine. This loan would be secured using frozen Russian assets. The proposal aims to assist Ukraine in recovering from the impacts of the ongoing conflict.

title: Women’s Cricket World Cup: Australia v New Zealand – live
summary: Australia begins their 50-over title defense at Holkar Stadium in Indore. Megan Maurice is providing live updates throughout the match. Fans can follow along for over-by-over reports.

title: Ed Miliband vows to ban fracking and warns Reform would ‘trash our climate commitments’ – UK politics live
summary: Currently, there is no legal framework for a permanent ban; only a temporary moratorium is in effect. This means restrictions are in place but not established as a permanent statute. The situation is subject to change as discussions continue.

title: Israel to close last remaining route from southern Gaza to the north as it continues offensive on Gaza City – Middle East crisis live
summary: Hamas announced it will evaluate the details of the Gaza peace plan. This comes as leaders from various Middle Eastern countries express their backing for the initiative. The review signals a potential shift in Hamas's approach to the ongoing conflict.

title: Ruthless Australia crush New Zealand by six wickets in first T20I
summary: Australia dominated the Black Caps in the first match of the three-match T20 series at Bay Oval, Tauranga. The match showcased Australia's strong performance, leading to a significant victory. Angus Fontaine reported on the over-by-over action throughout the game.
